title: South Carolina State Employees (2019 - 2022) - updated

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: South Carolina State Employees (2019 - 2022) - updated
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Monthly electronic listings of all employees of the South Carolina Executive Branch from January 2019 through March 2022. Specifically, I am seeking electronic listings of all individuals employed within all state agencies, commissions, and departments for each month from January 2019 through March 2022.

This is an updated request from my original request, which I submitted on May 11, 2022. In addition to the variables I received from my original request (first name, middle name, last name, suffix, annual salary, agency, job class title, position title, ethnic origin, and gender), I would like to request the following fields: employee date of birth or age, civil service status (classified, unclassified, etc.), original date employee was hired by the state, and the location the employee works (for instance, county, address of workplace, and/or name of workplace (e.g. Livesay Correctional Institution)) . 

If you cannot produce any of these fields, please let me know and generate only the available variables.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

title: Correctional Infraction Data (2019 - 2022)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information on all disciplinary infractions given to incarcerated individuals from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022 at facilities operated by the Division of Correction. Specifically, I am seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following information for each individual disciplinary infraction: 

•	Inmate full legal name
•	Inmate ID number assigned by the department
•	Date
•	Full legal name of the officer issuing the infraction
•	Full legal name of supervising officer
•	Full legal name of the disciplinary hearing officer (if applicable) 
•	The facility the incident occurred in
•	Security level inmate is held in
•	Time of the incident
•	Place of the incident within the prison
•	Officer’s written description of the incident
•	Inmate’s response to the infraction
•	Was force used and what type of force?
•	Specific infractions accused of
•	Severity level of the infraction
•	Outcome of the infraction (guilty, not guilty, withdrawn, etc.) 
•	Penalty from the infraction (days of lost good time, days of solitary confinement, lost privileges, etc.)
•	Was the penalty from the infraction changed or reduced at a later time?
•	Was the infraction appealed?
•	Names of witnesses involved

I recognize that each type of incident has different reporting requirements, so these are the general fields I need. 

I also recognize that this is a large request. The request is intentionally broad because I do not know what data the department maintains or for what timeframe. If necessary, I can refine my request due to time or cost considerations. 

Thank you for your assistance with this request. Please do not hesitate to contact for questions or clarifications.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicole Kanu, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Ben Goehring.

title: Fog Data Science

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Fog Data Science
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am submitting the following request for records under the Virginia Freedom of Information Act.

The requested records are all those describing and relating to the relationship between this agency and Fog Data Science, LLC and any relationships between any representative of either entity. For reference, VSP granted a Sole Source Award to Fog Data Science on October 5, 2022. The purchase order/contract number for that procurement action is 156-23-017/ EP3509339. The notice of that award is attached.

I request the following records for the period between January 1, 2020 and the date on which this request is processed:

• All documents concerning or mentioning Fog Data Science, LLC and any representative thereof, including all documentation regarding Fog Reveal and any other service or software provided by or created by Fog Data Science, LLC

CONTRACT AND AGREEMENTS
• All contracts, memorandums of understanding, and any other written agreements between this agency and Fog Data Science, including all associated amendments, exhibits, and supplemental and supporting documentation. 

FINANCIAL MATERIALS
• All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the relationship between the aforementioned entities. Responsive materials include all invoices, bills, receipts, check stubs, or any other records, including those possessed in an electronic format. This also includes any Requests for Proposal and bidding materials provided by Fog Data Science and any other entities responding to the same Request for Proposal or equivalent procurement request. 

MARKETING and PROMOTION MATERIALS
• All promotional, descriptive, and marketing materials in the possession of this agency related to and/or referencing “Fog Data Science” and/or “Fog Reveal.” This includes all presentations, marketing materials, technical documentation, proposals, or similar records shared with this agency and/or any representative thereof by Fog Data Science and/or any representative thereof.

GUIDING DOCUMENTATION and POLICIES
• All policies, memorandums of understanding, and other guidance materials generated by this agency and/or any entity operating on its behalf or to its benefit (including, but not limited to, any unions, community groups, other government agencies, or individuals) regarding the acquisition and use of any data or services provided by Fog Data Science or any subdivision thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to, any data-sharing agreements, terms of use, licensing agreements, and any other guiding materials. 

• All user manuals, other guidance materials, help documents, or related materials obtained from Fog Data Science or the Fog Reveal platform (hosted at www.fogreveal.com)

DOCUMENTATION OF USE
• Any query logs and other data obtained from the Fog Reveal platform, including any “Signal List” CSV documents generated by the platform. Should query logs exist for any other platform, service, or software created and/or provided by Fog Data Science, these materials are also responsive to this request.

COMMUNICATIONS
• All written communications, emails, and attachments between this agency and any representative thereof and Fog Data Science and any representative thereof. Responsive materials include, but are not limited to, all communications sent to and from any “@fogdatascience.com” email address, including but not limited to:
• admin@fogreveal.com
• support@fogdatascience.com
• info@fogdatascience.com
• mmassop@fogdatascience.com
• rlisk@fogdatascience.com
• mbroderick@fogdatascience.com

• All written communications, emails, and attachments containing and/or referencing any of the following terms:
• Fog Data Science
• Fog Reveal
• fogreveal.com
• fogdatascience.com
• FDS Reveal
• FDS Portal
• FDS Reveal Portal

I ask that these materials be provided on a rolling basis; as your office collects and reviews records, I would appreciate it if your office would provide those materials to me incrementally. If possible, please provide any responsive contractual and financial materials within the statutorily-mandated public record law time frame. I would prefer communications to be provided next. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Bennett Cyphers.

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine State Employees (2018 - 2022)
communications.communication:
Hello,
This email is in response to a request seeking information pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act.

The Department of Administrative and Financial Services (DAFS ) acknowledges your request, while simultaneously reserving the right to withhold, in part or in full, documents that are protected from disclosure by rule or statute.  Once we complete our review of the requested material, DAFS will provide you with an estimate of the time necessary to complete the process of responding to your request.  We may also require the payment of costs as authorized by law.

DAFS will notify you, within a reasonable time, of a date and time for review and copying of the documents (or by transmitting copies to you) not protected from disclosure.  Should any of the requested documents be withheld, we will identify the reason for not disclosing them.

Maine Department of Administrative and Financial Services
https://www.maine.gov/dafs/

title: Diplomatic Assurance Removals (Department of Homeland Security)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Diplomatic Assurance Removals under CAT - Regulatory Background
U.S. law implementing the Convention Against Torture (CAT) creates a statutory right not to be deported to a country where a person demonstrates to the satisfaction of the Attorney General, acting through the Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR), that it is more likely than not they will be tortured if they are removed to that country. U.S. regulations purportedly implementing this statute allow for the removal of a person granted deferral under CAT to the very country they’ve shown they’d be tortured, provided certain conditions are met. 8 C.F.R. 208.17(f) & 208.18(c). A person can be so removed, under these regulations, if the Secretary of State forwards Diplomatic Assurances to the Attorney General from the country that the Attorney General previously found (through a removal proceeding) would be more likely than not to torture an individual, the inquiry before the immigration court is over. 8 C.F.R. 208.18(f) & 208.18(c)(1)-(3). 

Diplomatic Assurance Removals under CAT -Executive Process 
According to these regulations, at least four nodes must exist in the determination of Diplomatic Assurances, and in executing removals under them. First, the Secretary of State must obtain the assurances. 8 C.F.R. 208.18(c)(1). This likely requires coordination with State Legal (L), Consular Affairs (CA), and other bureaus within the Department of State. Second, State must forward to the Attorney General, and the AG must make a determination as to whether these assurances are sufficient. That determination cannot be delegated below a deputy (DAG) level within the Department of Justice. 208.18(c)(2). Third, the Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR), acting through an Immigration Court or Board of Immigration Appeals (BIA), must vacate the deferral, and refrain from entering any other proceedings. 208.17(f) & 208.18(c)(2). Fourth, ICE must execute the removal order.

title: FEDERAL WAY SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2021) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2021

communications.communication:
FEDERAL WAY SCHOOL DISTRICT – (2021) Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including the District Responses for the year 2021

Via email: publicrecordsrequest@fwps.org

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1.	I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by your agency in the year 2021 and a complete electronic copy of your agency's Responses to each of these Public Records Requests for the year 2021.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2021 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

 RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Note: Parents and students seeking GRADES and/or TRANSCRIPTS in the year 2021 can be excluded from this request.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

 RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.
 
"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Open Records Request :: W027614-112122
communications.communication:
Welcome to the City of Laredo Open Records Center. We have received your Public Information Request, and it has been diverted to the appropriate department for processing. Pursuant to the Public Information Act, the governmental body will try to complete the request within a reasonable amount of time depending on the nature of the request. However, you can expect to receive notification should the request require more than 10 business days to complete. 

Please note, the Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. The request must ask for records or information already in existence. In addition, the City of Laredo may collect a fee as prescribed by law or regulation for the requested documents. If a fee is not prescribed by law or regulation, the fee shall be the actual cost of duplicating the record(s) and any applicable labor costs. 

Finally, you can monitor the progress of your request through the automated open records center on the City of Laredo website .  Unfortunately, this email is an automated notification, which is unable to receive replies. Therefore, if you have any questions with respect to a pending request or pertaining to any open records issue,  you may directly contact this office through the open records center.  You may also reach us by phone at the number below. 

Very truly yours, 

City Attorney's Office 
Public Information Coordinator for the City of Laredo 
1110 Houston Street 
City Hall, 3rd Floor 
Laredo, Texas 78040 
(956) 791-7319 Telephone 
(956) 791-7494 Facsimile

title: Biden CDRs, Take 2

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Biden CDRs, Take 2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide a record showing a list of all Contract Discrepancy Reports issued by the Biden Administration to ICE detention or medical contractors.  

Please acknowledge this request and assign it an individualized tracking number within the statutorily mandated period. We previously submitted a similar request, but have received nothing from your office: https://www.muckrock.com/foi/united-states-of-america-10/biden-cdrs-117415/. 

Please task searches with OPLA-GILD, ERO, OAQ, and ICE HQ, with a search period of January 20, 2021 - November 20, 2022. 

Please assign this request a simple-track processing identifier, as it seeks only a simple list of reports that should be easily accessible within any of these custodians’ records systems. 

Please respond to this request within the statutorily allotted time frame, including providing and estimated date of completion. 

Thank you, 

Andrew Free
#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free
